simpleText: There are some passages in the Holy Qur'an which some Muslim scholars interpreted the meaning that the earth is spread out. Those passages simply has the purpose of indicating that God has made the earth the level for you so nice spread surface (land) but if we think more globally we find that the Qur'an speaks of the earth is something which is actually round. Qur'an says,   "...HE coils the night upon the day and he coils the day upon the night."The whole act of coiling indicates the spherical object. The idea that the earth is spherical like an OSTRICH EGG is indicated "He made is egg-shaped bringing forth its water and pastures  and setting the mountains firmly upon it."which should be the best modern scientific explanation or translation give to that verse. As a Muslim if I say the earth is flat then my faith in Islam will be renounced. Because Qur'an doesn't say that. As a believer we believe earth is like "Dahaha" means Ostrich egg-shaped.

simpleText: Surah Luqman (31:29) "Do you not see that Allah causes the night to enter the day and the day to enter the night?"This verse describes the gradual transition of night into day, which is only possible on a spherical Earth where the sunlight and darkness can seamlessly transition across its surface.
author: @MRREACT335

simpleText: Surah An-Nazi’at (79:30) "And after that He spread the earth."The Arabic word used here is "dahaha," which some scholars interpret as "shaped like an ostrich egg," implying a rounded.
author: @MRREACT335

simpleText: Surah Az-Zumar (39:5) "He created the heavens and the earth for truth. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night..."The word "wrap" (كَوَّرَ) is used here, which is often interpreted to suggest a spherical nature of the Earth, since wrapping implies a round object.
author: @MRREACT335

simpleText: Flat Earth is an archaic and scientifically disproven conception of the Earth's shape as a plane or disk. Many ancient cultures subscribed to a flat-Earth cosmography, notably including ancient near eastern cosmology. The model has undergone a recent resurgence as a conspiracy theory.[1]  The idea of a spherical Earth appeared in ancient Greek philosophy with Pythagoras (6th century BC). However, most pre-Socratics (6th–5th century BC) retained the flat-Earth model. In the early 4th century BC, Plato wrote about a spherical Earth. By about 330 BC, his former student Aristotle had provided strong empirical evidence for a spherical Earth. Knowledge of the Earth's global shape gradually began to spread beyond the Hellenistic world.[2][3][4][5] By the early period of the Christian Church, the spherical view was widely held, with some notable exceptions. In contrast, ancient Chinese scholars consistently describe the Earth as flat, and this perception remained unchanged until their encounters with Jesuit missionaries in the 17th century.[6] Traditionalist Muslim scholars have maintained that the earth is flat, though, since the 9th century, Muslim scholars tended to believe in a spherical Earth.[7][8]  It is a historical myth that medieval Europeans generally thought the Earth was flat.[9] This myth was created in the 17th century by Protestants to argue against Catholic teachings.[10] More recently, flat earth theory has seen an increase in popularity with modern flat Earth societies, and unaffiliated individuals using social media.[11][12] Despite the scientific facts and obvious effects of Earth's sphericity, pseudoscientific[13] flat-Earth conspiracy theories persist. In a 2018 study reported on by Scientific American, only 82% of 18 to 24 year old respondents agreed with the statement "I have always believed the world is round". However, a firm belief in a flat Earth is rare, with less than 2% acceptance in all age groups.[14
author: @rajupophale3797

simpleText: Al-Biruni: He conducted extensive calculations and measurements to determine the Earth's radius. He concluded that the Earth is spherical and provided methods for measuring its circumference.  Ibn al-Haytham (Alhazen): While primarily known for his work in optics, he supported the idea of a spherical Earth in his writings, referencing earlier Greek scholars like Ptolemy.  Ibn Rushd (Averroes): In his commentaries on Aristotle, he defended the idea of a spherical Earth and its implications for cosmology.  Al-Khwarizmi: He produced maps and texts that contributed to a better understanding of the Earth's geography and also supported the spherical model.

simpleText: कुरान और पृथ्वी  "''""'"''"'"'""""""""""" इस से पहले मैं ने लिखा है कि कुरान विज्ञान की किताब नहीं है और यही सच है लेकिन ऐसा भी नहीं है कि कुरान जहालत व अंधविश्वास फैलाती हो   जमीन चिपटी है इस बात को लेकर हंगामा खड़ा कर दिया जाता है कोई बात हो तुरंत ताना मारा जाता है कि कुरान में लिखा है जमीन चिपटी है और इस का प्रभाव इतना बढ़ गया है कि मुसलमान जवाब देता है लेकिन यह नहीं कह पाता है कि कुरान में ऐसा नहीं लिखा है   कुरान अल्लाह की किताब है इस का मकसद है कि लोगों को अल्लाह की ओर बुलाना उन से कहना कि सिर्फ अल्लाह की इबादत करो इस चीज़ को वह विभिन्न तरीकों से समझाता है कभी अल्लाह का एहसान जता कर कभी इनाम का लालच देकर कभी सज़ा से डराकर   कुरान में जहां कहीं जमीन के बनाने की बात आई है वह इंसान से अल्लाह का प्यार और इंसान पर अल्लाह का एहसान जताने के लिए आई है   जैसे अल्लाह कहता है कि जमीन को बिस्तर बना दिया कहीं कहा कि जमीन को पालना बना दिया जाहिर है कि एक मां पालने में बच्चे को सुरक्षित रखती है और जैसे एक मां को बच्चे से प्यार है अल्लाह को भी बंदों से प्यार है एक जगह कहा कि जमीन को फैला दिया और फैलाने के लिए शब्द का प्रयोग किया دحاها  अरबी भाषा में दहा कहते हैं कि जब शुतुरमुर्ग को अंडा देना होता है तो वह काफ़ी दूर तक जमीन को समतल कर देती है वहां से हर उस चीज को हटा देती है जिससे अंडे से निकलने वाले बच्चे को तकलीफ़ हो सकती है जाहिर है ऐसा वह बच्चे से अपनी मोहब्बत के चलते करती है उसी प्रकार अल्लाह ने भी अपने बंदों से मोहब्बत में जमीन को समतल कर दिया है जाहिर है इस प्यार व मोहब्बत में विज्ञान नहीं तलाश किया जा सकता है   एक आयत है सूरा अल गाशिया में आयत नंबर 20 वह कुछ यूं है  " وإلى الأرض كيف سطحت " और जमीन की तरफ़ वह कैसे बिछा दी गई या कैसे समतल कर दी गई इस का तर्जुमा यह भी हो सकता है कि कैसे चिपटी कर दी गई इसी आयत को आधार बनाकर कुरान पर आक्रमण किया जाता है इस पर दो तीन चीजें ग़ौर करने की है   1- आयत में है कि जमीन समतल कर दी गई या चिपटी कर दी गई यानी वह अपने असल में चिपटी नहीं है वरना कुरान कहता الأرض مسطحة जमीन चिपटी है जाहिर है दोनों के अर्थ में अंतर है   2- पृथ्वी के इलावा जितने ग्रह हैं सब में बड़े बड़े गड्ढे हैं जिसे विज्ञान की भाषा में Crater कहते हैं पृथ्वी पर नहीं हैं यहां की जमीन समतल है जिस के कारण यहां जिंदा रहना संभव हो पाया कुरान का इशारा इसी ओर है जमीन के गोल या गोल न होने से इस का कोई संबंध नहीं है   3- इस आयत में जमीन के लिए सुतेहत का शब्द आया है जो सतह शब्द से बना है और संयोग से इस अरबी शब्द का इस्तेमाल हिंदी भाषा में भी होता है और इसी अर्थ में होता है हिंदी भाषा में भी सतह जमीन के ऊपरी परत , Level ,  surface , पटल या फर्श को कहते हैं   भूगोल शास्त्री समुद्र की सतह की बात करते हैं प्लंबर पानी की सतह की वैज्ञानिक जमीन की सतह Crust की बात करते हैं कृषि वैज्ञानिक जमीन के उपजाऊ या उपजाऊ न होने के लिए सतह शब्द का प्रयोग करते हैं   एक प्लंबर एक इंजीनियर एक वैज्ञानिक एक कृषि वैज्ञानिक एक भूगोल शास्त्री जमीन को गोल मानते हुए भी जमीन के लिए सतह शब्द का प्रयोग कर सकता है तो कुरान क्यों नहीं कर सकता है जैसे ही क़ुरान इस शब्द का इस्तेमाल करता है आप जहालत का ताना देते हो हसने लगते हो   सच यह है कि आप कुंठित हो कुरान में कमी नहीं आप में कमी है   - Khursheeid ahmad (Facebook)

simpleText: बाइबल यह दावा नहीं करती कि पृथ्वी सपाट (flat) है। बाइबल की कुछ आयतों को लोग गलत तरीके से समझ सकते हैं, लेकिन इसका अर्थ शाब्दिक नहीं बल्कि प्रतीकात्मक होता है। उदाहरण के लिए, "पृथ्वी के चार कोने" जैसी भाषा का उपयोग दिशाओं (उत्तर, दक्षिण, पूर्व, पश्चिम) को संदर्भित करने के लिए किया जाता है, न कि यह बताने के लिए कि पृथ्वी का आकार सपाट है।बाइबल में एक और वचन है जो पृथ्वी की गोलाकारता का संकेत देता है। उदाहरण के लिए, यशायाह 40:22

simpleText: Sir, I am writing to request your urgent attention to a grave injustice being perpetrated against the tribal community in Maharashtra. The state government is systematically discriminating against us. Non-tribal communities, such as the Dhangars, are being granted Scheduled Tribe (ST) reservations, thereby depriving us of our rightful benefits. Furthermore, the government is failing to comply with the Supreme Court’s order to fill 12,500 vacancies. Individuals with fraudulent caste certificates are being appointed to these positions, further exacerbating the situation. Despite the existence of the Panchayat Extension to Scheduled Areas Act (PESA Act 1996), we are being denied our right to employment. Given your influential platform, I humbly request that you create a YouTube video highlighting these injustices. Your support could be instrumental in bringing about much-needed change.

simpleText: Qur'an is clear when it says the earth is flat there is not one but multiple direct and indirect refrences that is why early Islamic scholars claim that that the earth is flat.~   Qur'an 2:22~ [He] who made for you the earth a bed [spread out] and the sky a ceiling Here, فِرَٰشًا = firashan = a thing that is spread upon the ground, a thing that is spread for one to sit or lie upon.  Qur'an 13:3~ And it is He who spread the earth and placed therein firmly set mountains and rivers; Here Allah is setting mountain because Mohammad believed the earth to be flat and if it has no mountain it will fly off like a carpet.  مَدَدْ = madad (madda) = extend by drawing or pulling, stretch out, expand The Quran describes a reversal of this process occurring on the last day. It says the mountains will be removed and the earth left as a level plain (Quran 18:47  Qur'an 20:53~ [It is He] who has made for you the earth as a bed [spread out] and inserted therein for you roadways and sent down from the sky, rain and produced thereby categories of various plants. مَهْدًا = mahdan = cradle or bed; a plain, even, or smooth expanse And the earth have We laid out, how gracious is the Spreader (thereof)! Quran 51:47-48 فَرَشَْ = farasha (verse 2:22 uses this word in the noun form) = spread or expand, spread a bed or carpet  الْمَهِدُونَ = mahidoon from مهد = make plain, even, smooth, spread a bed[14]  A hadith in Ibn Majah uses the plural noun furushaat to mean "beds":

simpleText: the Quran informs us that the Earth is round almost 1400 years ago in Surah Naziat verse 30, Surah Zumar verse 5 and Surah Rahman verse 33.  وَالْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَاهَا  And after that He spread the earth. Surah Naziat 79:30  ٥ خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ يُكَوِّرُ اللَّيْلَ عَلَى النَّهَارِ وَيُكَوِّرُ النَّهَارَ عَلَى اللَّيْلِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ يَجْرِي لِأَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۗ أَلَا هُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفَّارُ  He created the heavens and earth in truth. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. Unquestionably, He is the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver. Surah Zumar 39:5  يَا مَعْشَرَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنْسِ إِنِ اسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَنْ تَنْفُذُوا مِنْ أَقْطَارِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ فَانْفُذُوا ۚ لَا تَنْفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلْطَانٍ  O company of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, then pass. You will not pass except by authority. Surah Rahman 55:33  Miracle In The Use Of Word “دَحَاهَا” Ostrich And Its Egg In Surah Naziat verse 30 the word used is “دَحَاهَا” translated by early Commentators of Quran as “spreading out” but in its wordings, it contains all the meanings for the coming generations. That is for the previous human generations this verse was giving a sense as per their time, and for us again, the verse has the capacity that it gives new meaning as per our modern understanding of science. In past the more appropriate meanings were ignored because people were not able to understand and connect those meanings with the verse. The meaning of the verb “دَحَاهَا” is more than just an ordinary setting or expanding of a thing. The concept of roundness is also present in other words derived from “د حو.” which describes setting out in a circle i.e to spread or ‘expand out giving something a round shape. Also, it means the place of laying of eggs of Ostrich and sometimes the Ostrich Egg itself. Also as in phrase دحا البطن The belly was or became large, distended, inflated. That is it indicates something spherical, rounded, or arched, not something that is flat or square. Now look that if we take the shape of Ostrich egg it is not completely round but somewhat oval-shaped and the Miracle is that just recently we came to know that the shape of the earth is not a circle or round shape but spheroid with depressions at the poles.  Arabic Word “يُكَوِّرُ” And View Of The Earth From Space Earth View From Space Further when we look at Surah Zumar verse 5 the word used are “He (God) wraps the night over the day”. The Arabic word “يُكَوِّرُ” translated as “Wraps” and it means to revolve upon, fold up, flow into, shroud, make one thing lap over an other. It is used for the act of wrapping one thing around another in the way that a turban is folded on the head. This revolving or folding of the day and night can only take place if the earth is spherical. If the earth was flat, then the day and night would change suddenly. If we look the earth from space this is exactly what we see that day and nights are rolling over a spherical ball like the image on the right. Surah Rahman Use Of Word “أَقْطَارِ” Miracle Diameter Animation Lastly, in Surah Rahman verse 33, we see that God is talking about “..if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth…” Now again as before past Commentators of Quran took the meaning of word “أَقْطَارِ” as “regions” but now when we have modern terms of science than the Arabic language have adopted the word “قطر” for defining “Diameter” And this was done independently by the evolution of language without knowing that this is something going to serve as another miracle of the Holy Quran. Now we know that Diameter is a straight line passing from side to side through the center of a body or figure, especially a circle or sphere. Thus look again Quran is consistent in representing Earth as a sphere that’s why the word “أَقْطَارِ” is used which again shows the rounded shape of earth. DETAILED ANALYSIS OF THE IMPORTANT WORDS USED IS GIVEN BELOW دَحَاهَا The fourth word of verse 79:30 is divided into two morphological segments. A verb and object pronoun. The perfect verb فعل ماض is the third person masculine singular. The verb’s root is (د ح و). The attached object pronoun is third person feminine singular. This root occurs only once in the Quran, as the form I verb daḥā (دَحَىٰ).  V – 3rd person masculine singular perfect verb فعل ماض و«ها» ضمير متصل في محل نصب مفعول به  PRON – 3rd person feminine singular object pronoun  (د ح و) : Spread, spread out, expanded or extended, made wide or ample/ also means, he compressed her, or lay with her. The place of laying of eggs of Ostrich. دحا البطن The belly was or became large, distended, inflated. “Medahi”: Rounded stones.  يُكَوِّرُ The fifth word of verse 39:5 is a form II imperfect verb فعل مضارع. The verb is third person masculine singular and is in the indicative mood مرفوع. The verb’s root is (ك و ر). This root occurs three times in the Quran as the form II verb kuwwirat (كُوِّرَتْ)  V – 3rd person masculine singular (form II) imperfect verb فعل مضارع  (ك و ر): I کورالعمامة: He wound/folded the turban in a spiral form and folded it up. کورہ: He threw him down. It also means be eclipsed. To wind, twist. Kawwaraکور : to revolve upon, fold up, flow into, shroud, make one thing lap over an other, cause to intertwine. Takwîr تکویر: The act of folding.  أَقْطَارِ The ninth word of verse 55:33 is a masculine plural noun and is in the genitive case مجرور. The noun’s root is (ق ط ر). This root occurs five times in the Quran, in three derived forms.  N – genitive masculine plural noun اسم مجرور  (ق ط ر): To drop, drip (liquid). Aqtâr plu. of Qutrun: A side, part, portion, quarter, tract or region. Qitran: Molten copper. Diameter of a circle or sphere.

simpleText: Let's ask the artificial intelligence what it says about sun's movement. Human --does the sun moves .chatgpt ---Yes, the sun moves in two ways:    Rotation The sun rotates on its axis once every 27 days, but the speed of rotation varies by latitude. The sun's equator rotates faster than its poles, taking about 24 days at the equator and more than 30 days at the poles. This is because the sun is a ball of gas and plasma, not a solid, so it doesn't have to rotate rigidly like planets and moons. The sun's rotation axis is tilted by 7.25 degrees relative to the plane of the planets' orbits.    Revolution The sun and the entire solar system revolve around the center of the Milky Way galaxy.    The sun keeps spinning because of the Law of Conservation of Angular Momentum, which states that there's nothing to stop it in space because there's no friction and nothing is grabbing it. """"   Discovered after 1990 ,but what Quran says 1400 years ago mentioned in your comment.Quran has uttered a single word about Earth, in Arabic "dahaha",which means like the egg of ostrich,which is spherical.

simpleText: I am a practicing muslim, Alhamdulillah, but I have never seen any Muslim scholar and even a namely Muslim who believes in flat earth theory. Allah says in Surah Al-Zumar in Quran, Verse 5: خَلَقَ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَالۡاَرۡضَ بِالۡحَقِّ‌ ۚ يُكَوِّرُ الَّيۡلَ عَلَى النَّهَارِ وَيُكَوِّرُ النَّهَارَ عَلَى الَّيۡلِ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمۡسَ وَالۡقَمَرَ‌ؕ كُلٌّ يَّجۡرِىۡ لِاَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى‌ؕ اَلَا هُوَ الۡعَزِيۡزُ الۡغَفَّارُ ۞ He created the heavens and the earth for a purpose. He wraps the night around the day, and wraps the day around the night. And He has subjected the sun and the moon, each orbiting for an appointed term. He is truly the Almighty, Most Forgiving.  [Indicating a curved or spherical shaped earth]  Scholarly Interpretations: 1. Ibn Kathir (renowned Quran commentator): "The Quran describes the Earth as round, like a ball." (Tafsir Ibn Kathir, Surah Al-Qamar) 2. Ibn Hazm (Andalusian scholar): "The Earth is spherical in shape." (Al-Fasl fi al-Milal wa al-Ahwa' wa al-Nihal)

simpleText: — Qur'an, Explanation: In the Quran, the Arabic word "aqtar" [ أَقْطَارِ ] is used to describe the entire region of the Earth. This term means zones, regions, and diameters. The mention of diameter in this context strongly suggests that the Earth is ball-shaped according to the Quran.  In Sura 39, verse 5 of the Quran, it states:  [39:5] He created the heavens and the earth truthfully. He rolls the night over the day, and rolls the day over the night. He committed the sun and the moon, each running for a finite period. Absolutely, He is the Almighty, the Forgiving.  خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِٱلْحَقِّ يُكَوِّرُ ٱلَّيْلَ عَلَى ٱلنَّهَارِ وَيُكَوِّرُ ٱلنَّهَارَ عَلَى ٱلَّيْلِ وَسَخَّرَ ٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ كُلٌّ يَجْرِى لِأَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى أَلَا هُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْغَفَّـٰرُ  The Arabic for “He rolls” (Yukawwir / يُكَوِّرُ ) is derived from the Arabic word for “ball” (kurah / كرة ). This verse clearly informs us that the earth is round. Since the Earth is not exactly round, a specific reference to its shape is given in Sura 79, verse 30. The Arabic word used to describe the Earth in this verse is daḥāhā ( دَحَاهَا ), which is typically translated as “egg-shaped” or “spread.”

simpleText: Earth Is Stated Falt In quran read it  The Earth’s Condition Stated in the Quran  Allah SWT explains about the earth using several words describing it. Among the words used to describe the earth are, “We spread” (Surah al-Hijr: 19), “spread/expanse” (Surah al-Naba’:6, Surah al-Baqarah: 22, Surah Nuh: 19, Surah al-Nazi’at :30) and “spread out” (Surah al-Ghasyiah: 20).  Allah SWT states:  الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ فِرَاشًا وَالسَّمَاءَ بِنَاءً  “[He] who made for you the earth a bed [spread out]”  Surah al-Baqarah (22)  Allah SWT states:  وَالْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَاهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ مَّوْزُونٍ  “And the earth - We have spread it and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.”  Surah al-Hijr (19)  Allah SWT states:  وَهُوَ الَّذِي مَدَّ الْأَرْضَ وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنْهَارًا  “And it is He who spread the earth and placed therein firmly set mountains and rivers;”   Surah al-Ra’d (3)  Allah SWT states:  وَالْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَاهَا ﴿٣٠﴾ أَخْرَجَ مِنْهَا مَاءَهَا وَمَرْعَاهَا  “And after that He spread the earth. He extracted from it its water and its pasture,”  Surah al-Nazi’at (30-31)  Allah SWT states:  وَإِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَيْفَ سُطِحَتْ  “And at the earth - how it is spread out?”  Surah al-Ghasyiah (20

simpleText: No, Earth is not flat. Scientific evidence shows that Earth is an oblate spheroid, meaning it is mostly spherical but slightly flattened at the poles and bulging at the equator. simpleText: Qur'an doesn't say earth is flat it says  The Quran doesn't explicitly describe the Earth's shape, but several verses mention the Earth's creation, size, and proportions. Here are some relevant verses:   Verses indicating the Earth's shape:  1. Surah Al-Rahman (55:17) - "And He has made the earth egg-shaped (dahaha) for you."     - Note: "Dahaha" is an Arabic word meaning "egg-shaped" or "expanded."  2. Surah An-Naml (27:61) - "Is not He Who has made the earth a resting-place for you, and the sky a canopy?"     - Implication: The Earth is described as a resting-place, suggesting a relatively flat or stable surface.   Verses describing the Earth's creation and proportions:  1. Surah Fussilat (41:9-10) - "Say: 'Is it that ye deny Him Who created the earth in two Days? And do ye join equals with Him?'" 2. Surah Al-Zumar (39:5) - "He created the heavens and the earth in truth, and He shaped you and made you perfect." 3. Surah An-Naziat (79:30) - "And the earth, moreover, hath He extended (madad)."     - Note: "Madad" implies expansion or extension.   Interpretations:  Scholars have interpreted these verses in various ways:   1. Some understand "dahaha" (egg-shaped) to imply a spherical or oval shape.  These are some more verses for those who believe that muslims beleive in flat earth
